description.narrative: The programme will assist in promoting rule of law through provision of support to the justice and security sectors in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) Province.

participating-org.narrative: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC

activity-description.narrative: Holding of Legal aid clinics/Awareness Session, Establishing Legal aid desks, refurbishment of court rooms, refurbishment of information center and waiting sheds, Refurbishment of Prosecution office, Training of Judicial officers, Police and prosecution officials, and training of young lawyers. In 7 districts of Malakand division and three district of southern KP (Kohat, Bannu and DI Khan) Rule of Law programme is assisting vulnerable population including women and poor litigants of the districts, duty bearers including district judiciary, police, prosecution etc, visitors visiting distric

In 7 districts of Malakand division these include Shangla, Swat Buner, Malakand, Dir Lower, Dir Upper and Chitral, Rule of Law programme is implementing the same nature of activities targeting vulnerable population including women and poor litigants of the districts, duty bearers including district

provider-org.narrative: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 2.1: Extent to which the DRCs are compliant with international ADR standards 2.2: Extent to which paralegals (45% women) are systematically trained to provide community-based services 2.3: Number of lawyers trained on ADR 2.4: The course established on conflict resolution and peace building at a local university 4.1: Extent to which the police is capacitated to develop and implement district police plans 4.2: Extent to which trust and accountability established between police and the community 4.4: Extent to which police applies modernized techniques in case reporting, recording, and accountability 4.5: Extent to which the police is capacitated through institutional support and training for better policing service delivery 4.6: Number of prosecution office provided furniture and equipment 5.1: Number of impact studies conducted 5.2: Extent to which the project uses evidence base for optimal programming and adaption make

comment.narrative: 2.1: Moderate compliance 2.2: 1589 paralegals 2.3: 122 2.4: 174 4.1: [ Limited capacity] (public consultations held, objectives for plans identified) 4.2: [ Scale:3=regular engagement of the police with community (scheduled meetings held in a planned manner with designated focal points) ] 4.4: [Scale 1 : minimal application of modernized techinques (functional systems with manual entry and limited to district level)] 4.5: [Scale 1: limited capacity (training curriculum not reviewed, no M&E system and strategy for training in place, limited training and skills, limited resources) 4.6: 13 5.1: 1 (mid-term evaluation conducted earlier) 5.2: Moderate use of visibility and communication
